solution_line_template: Aaron used {aaron_scarves} scarves * {wool_per_scarf} balls of wool = <<{aaron_scarves}*{wool_per_scarf}={aaron_wool_for_scarves}>>{aaron_wool_for_scarves} balls of wool to make his scarves.

He also used {aaron_sweaters} sweaters * {wool_per_sweater} balls of wool = <<{aaron_sweaters}*{wool_per_sweater}={aaron_wool_for_sweaters}>>{aaron_wool_for_sweaters} balls of wool to make his sweaters.
Enid used {enid_sweaters} sweaters * {wool_per_sweater} balls of wool = <<{enid_sweaters}*{wool_per_sweater}={enid_wool_for_sweaters}>>{enid_wool_for_sweaters} balls of wool to make her sweaters.

So in total, Aaron used {aaron_wool_for_scarves} + {aaron_wool_for_sweaters} + {enid_wool_for_sweaters} = <<{aaron_wool_for_scarves}+{aaron_wool_for_sweaters}+{enid_wool_for_sweaters}={total_wool}>>{total_wool} balls of wool.
